page.title: 11Cheshunt 60 years ago
page.content: Families were larger with about eight members.Fathers worked locally ,but mothers did not work.Houses had no dining room,bathroom or inside toilet. Children went to sunday school,read the bible,and could not play on Sundays.Girls wore long dresses,a white pinafore,and high leather buttoned boots.Food was cooked on an open kitchen range,and in the range oven.Children went to British School at Gews Corner ,or Robert Dewhurst school.Teachers were strict,used the cane,with classes of 50.There were no school dinners,homework,outings. Prices were lower,but so were wages,lb potatoes was 1/2d,tea 2d.Items were sold loose.Public transport was cheap, 1d a mile,but few busses reached Cheshunt.Trams reached Waltham Cross. People travelled by push bike.Horse drawn barges used the River Lea.
